description: Multifidelity function approximation involves creating models that can leverage both high-fidelity and low-fidelity data to predict outcomes more accurately and efficiently. This is particularly useful in scenarios where high-fidelity data is scarce or expensive to obtain.
you_have_this_if: You have a limited amount of high-fidelity data.
You possess a large dataset of low-fidelity data.
You need to model complex functions.
You are looking to reduce data collection costs.
You require interpretable results from your models.

approaches.best_for: When you have limited high-fidelity data but abundant low-fidelity data and need interpretable results.
approaches.key_tradeoff: This approach balances the use of low-fidelity data to improve predictions while maintaining interpretability.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need to model complex functions with limited high-fidelity data and want to leverage abundant low-fidelity data.

start_here: Start with Multifidelity Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (MFKANs) as they effectively utilize low-fidelity data to enhance model accuracy while providing interpretable results.
